metadata.title: CVE-2023-52829 on Ubuntu 22.04 FIPS Undergoing Certification (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: wifi:ath12k: fix possible out-of-bound write in ath12k_wmi_ext_hal_reg_caps()reg_cap.phy_id is extracted from WMI event and could be an unexpected valuein case some errors happen. As a result out-of-bound write may occur tosoc->hal_reg_cap. Fix it by validating reg_cap.phy_id before using it. Thisis found during code review. Compile tested only.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1014-nvidia - 6.5.0-1014.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1014-nvidia-64k - 6.5.0-1014.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
linux-hwe-6.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.5').
